title: Mount Roland (Antarctica)
text: Mount Roland () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, , directly north of <a href="Mount%20Mooney">Mount Mooney</a> on the north flank of <a href="Robison%20Glacier">Robison Glacier</a>, in the <a href="Queen%20Maud%20Mountains">Queen Maud Mountains</a>. Mapped by <a href="United%20States%20Geological%20Survey">United States Geological Survey</a> (USGS) from surveys and <a href="U.S.%20Navy">U.S. Navy</a> air photos, 1960–64. Named by <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> (US-ACAN) for Lieutenant (j.g.) <a href="Charles%20J.%20Roland">Charles J. Roland</a>, aircraft navigator with U.S. Navy Squadron <a href="VX-6">VX-6</a> on <a href="Operation%20Deep%20Freeze">Operation Deep Freeze</a> 1966 and 1967.
